◆ SocketHTTPServer_set_rate_limit()

void SocketHTTPServer_set_rate_limit ( SocketHTTPServer_T  server,
const char *  path_prefix,
SocketRateLimit_T  limiter 
)
extern

Register a rate limiter for specific endpoints or globally.

Associates a SocketRateLimit_T instance with a path prefix (e.g., "/api/"). Incoming requests matching prefix (via Request_path() starts-with) checked against limiter before handler invocation. Exceeded limits trigger 429 Too Many Requests with Retry-After. NULL path_prefix applies globally (all requests). NULL limiter disables for prefix. Supports dynamic updates; affects new requests only.

Parameters
serverServer instance (running or not).
path_prefixPath prefix to match (e.g., "/api/v1", NULL=global), case-sensitive.
limiterRate limiter (owned by caller; server references, not frees).
Note
Up to HTTPSERVER_MAX_RATE_LIMIT_ENDPOINTS (64 default) slots.
Path matching simple prefix; for regex/glob, implement in validator.
Per-IP limits via max_connections_per_client; this is per-endpoint RPS.
Stats: rate_limited counter incremented on rejections.
See also
SocketRateLimit_T from Utilities group for token bucket config.
SocketHTTPServer_set_validator() for custom rate logic.
SocketHTTPServer_Stats.rate_limited for monitoring.
Utilities Group for SocketRateLimit details.
docs/SECURITY.md "Rate Limiting" for deployment tips.
Thread Safety\n No - updates server map; use mutex for multi-thread.

◆ SocketHTTPServer_set_validator()

void SocketHTTPServer_set_validator ( SocketHTTPServer_T  server,
SocketHTTPServer_Validator  validator,
void *  userdata 
)
extern

Install a middleware validator callback for incoming requests.

Registers a function executed after parsing headers but before body read/handler. Ideal for early rejection: auth (tokens, JWT), rate limiting, CORS, schema validation. Validator can set reject_status (e.g., 401) and return 0 to short-circuit (no handler). Runs per-request; stateful validators must be thread-safe or per-connection. Replaces prior validator; NULL disables.

Parameters
serverServer instance.
validatorCallback or NULL to disable validation.
userdataOpaque data passed to each invocation.
Note
Executes in event thread; fast operations preferred to avoid blocking poll.
Access to method, path, query, headers; body unavailable yet (use stream for large).
Rejection sends minimal error response (status + basic headers); customize via validator.
Chain multiple via wrapper if needed, but single slot provided.
See also
SocketHTTPServer_Validator callback signature and usage.
SocketHTTPServer_Request_* accessors available in validator (no body()).
SocketHTTPServer_set_rate_limit() for built-in endpoint limiting.
docs/SECURITY.md "Middleware and Validation" for patterns.
Thread Safety\n No - replaces server callback; concurrent set races.

◆ SocketHTTPServer_start()

int SocketHTTPServer_start ( SocketHTTPServer_T  server)
extern

Bind to address/port and start listening for incoming connections.

Performs system bind(2)/listen(2) on configured address/port using dual-stack IPv6 preferred (falls back to IPv4 if needed). Sets socket to non-blocking, reuseaddr/reuseport, and integrates with internal poll loop. Marks server as running; subsequent calls are no-ops (returns 0).

Does not block; returns immediately after setup. Use SocketHTTPServer_process() or external poll on SocketHTTPServer_fd() to accept/process connections.

Parameters
serverInitialized server instance (from SocketHTTPServer_new()).
Returns
0 on success (already running or bind/listen succeeded), -1 on error (errno set; may also raise exceptions).
Exceptions
SocketHTTPServer_BindFailedon bind/listen system errors (EADDRINUSE, etc.).
SocketHTTPServer_Failedon socket creation or config issues.
Thread Safety\n No - server state modified; concurrent calls undefined.
Note
Port 0 binds to ephemeral port; query Socket_getlocalport() after.
For HTTPS, ensure tls_context configured and SocketTLS_enable() integrated.
Conflicts with prior binds raise EADDRINUSE; check with netstat/ss.
See also
SocketHTTPServer_stop() to cease listening.
SocketHTTPServer_fd() for poll integration.
SocketConfig for global socket options affecting behavior.
Core I/O Group for underlying socket primitives.

Referenced by main().

◆ SocketHTTPServer_state()

SocketHTTPServer_State SocketHTTPServer_state ( SocketHTTPServer_T  server)
extern

Query the current lifecycle state of the server.

Returns enum indicating operational phase: RUNNING (normal), DRAINING (shutdown initiated), or STOPPED (no activity). Useful for monitoring, logging, or conditional logic during shutdown. Atomic read for concurrency safety.

Parameters
serverServer instance (any state).
Returns
SocketHTTPServer_State: RUNNING, DRAINING, or STOPPED.
Note
RUNNING: accepting/processing; DRAINING: finishing existing; STOPPED: idle/closed.
State changes via start()/stop()/drain()/free().
During DRAINING, process()/poll continue until complete.
See also
SocketHTTPServer_State enum definition.
SocketHTTPServer_drain() triggers DRAINING.
SocketHTTPServer_stop() may lead to DRAINING if connections active.
SocketHTTPServer_free() finalizes to implicit STOPPED.
docs/SIGNALS.md for state in signal handlers.
Thread Safety\n Yes - atomic enum read, no side effects.

◆ SocketHTTPServer_stop()

void SocketHTTPServer_stop ( SocketHTTPServer_T  server)
extern

Stop accepting new connections while allowing existing ones to complete.

Closes the listening socket to prevent new accepts. Existing connections continue processing requests until idle timeout, keep-alive expiry, or explicit drain. Does not abort in-flight requests or close client sockets. Server remains in running state until all connections drain or free().

Idempotent: safe to call multiple times.

Parameters
serverRunning server instance.
Thread Safety\n No - modifies server state.
Note
To force closure of all connections, use SocketHTTPServer_free() directly.
For graceful shutdown with timeout, prefer SocketHTTPServer_drain().
See also
SocketHTTPServer_drain() for full graceful shutdown.
SocketHTTPServer_state() to check status.
SocketPoll_del() if using external poll (server handles internally).

Referenced by main().

const unsigned char HTTP2_CLIENT_PREFACE[24] = "PRI * HTTP/2.0\r\n\r\nSM\r\n\r\n"
static

Client connection preface magic string per RFC 9113.

The fixed 24-byte sequence "\x50\x52\x49\x20\x2a\x20\x48\x54\x54\x50\x2f\x32\x2e\x30\x0d\x0a\x0d\x0a\x53\x4d\x0d\x0a\x0d\x0a" (ASCII: "PRI * HTTP/2.0\r\n\r\nSM\r\n\r\n") sent by clients to initiate HTTP/2.

See also

◆ sockethttp_hex_value

const unsigned char sockethttp_hex_value[256]
extern

Hexadecimal digit value lookup table for decoding and validation.

Static array[256] mapping ASCII characters to their hex value (0-15) for valid digits, or 255 for invalid characters. Supports '0'-'9', 'a'-'f', 'A'-'F'.

Essential for percent-decoding (XX sequences) in URIs and chunked encoding sizes.

See also

◆ SocketHTTP_InvalidHeader

const Except_T SocketHTTP_InvalidHeader
extern

SocketHTTP_InvalidHeader - Invalid HTTP header name or value.

Raised when adding or validating headers that violate RFC 9110 rules:

  • Invalid token characters in header names
  • Control characters (CR/LF/NUL) in header values (prevents injection)
  • Exceeding max name/value size limits
  • Header count exceeding configured maximum
See also
SocketHTTP_Headers_add() returns error but may raise in future strict modes.
SocketHTTP_header_name_valid() and SocketHTTP_header_value_valid() checks.

◆ sockethttp_tchar_table

const unsigned char sockethttp_tchar_table[256]
extern

Lookup table for valid HTTP token characters (tchar) per RFC 9110 5.6.

Static array[256] where non-zero value indicates the character is a valid token char for HTTP header field names and values (excluding separators like :, ;, etc.).

tchar ::= "!" / "#" / "$" / "%" / "&" / "'" / "*" / "+" / "-" / "." / "^" / "_" / "`" / "|" / "~" / DIGIT / ALPHA

Used for fast validation in header parsing and media type processing.

See also
SOCKETHTTP_IS_TCHAR() macro for usage.
Thread Safety\n Yes - static const array, read-only.
See also
SocketHTTP_Headers_add() for header validation context.

Socket Library

High-performance socket toolkit for POSIX systems with exception-based error handling and TLS 1.3 support.
